recommendations.recommendation: Random gag comedy, but at a very peaceful pace. The animals` antics will surely put a smile on your face!
Highly enjoyable episodic comedy show. Easy to watch and good for every mood

anime.description: The gag comedy follows the daily life of penguins, grizzly bears, and other animals at a cafe run by a polar bear. Source: ANN

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: tsukkomi
tag.description: A tsukkomi is a comedy duo stock character in a traditional Japanese slapstick stand-up comedy style known as manzai. Tsukkomi characters are the smart, reasonable, and down-to-earth half of the unit; their simple-minded counterparts are the http://anidb.net/t1399 [boke] characters. As a result of their boke counterparts` simple mistakes and gross exaggerations, tsukkomi berate and abuse them both verbally and physically; a very common example of tsukkomi physical abuse is a paper fan slap, which is generally accompanied by a sound effect. Their approximate equivalent in Western culture is the comedy role of straight man.

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: talking animal
tag.description: Talking animals are a common theme in mythology and folk tales, as well as children`s literature. Fictional talking creatures often are anthropomorphic, possessing human-like qualities but appearing as a creature. An animal that only knows how to say its name (for example, 99.9% of all http://anidb.net/t2493 [Pokemon]), are not talking animals.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: josei
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word josei refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 15 and 44. In Japanese, the word means simply "woman", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: anthropomorphism
tag.description: Anthropomorphism is the attribution of uniquely human characteristics to non-human beings, inanimate objects, or natural or supernatural phenomena. If it`s an animal or an object (AI excluded) and it speaks and/or does other human-like things (dresses up) then we`re dealing with anthropomorphism. Anthropomorphism leans more on the animal-looking side when compared to http://anidb.net/t7 [juujin], which leans more on the human-looking side.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: wordplay
tag.description: The characters play with words. E.g. purposely or accidentally use similar-sounding but wrongly applied words in the Japanese original, leading to supposedly funny misunderstandings and confusion.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: tanabata
tag.description: Tanabata (七夕, meaning "Evening of the seventh") is a Japanese star festival, originating from the Chinese Qixi Festival. It celebrates the meeting of the deities Orihime and Hikoboshi (represented by the stars Vega and Altair respectively). According to legend, the Milky Way separates these lovers, and they are allowed to meet only once a year on the seventh day of the seventh lunar month of the lunisolar calendar. The date of Tanabata varies by region of the country, but the first festivities begin on July 7 of the Gregorian calendar. The celebration is held at various days between July and August. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: animal protagonist
tag.description: The anime revolves around an animal, usually only communicating with typical onomatopoeia. The animal mostly lives in a human family and has adventures on a regular base. This can be the discovery of a new room, or being lost by having taken a wrong turn in the outside world. Typical example: http://anidb.net/a5801 [Chii`s Sweet Home]. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t4259 [animal world], where the whole world is composed of animals.

tag.name: cultural references
tag.description: The plot of this anime shows signs of cultural references, these are often jokes that make reference to a certain custom, habit or history that is specifically attributed to that culture. Knowledge of the culture itself is needed in order to properly understand these jokes.

tag.name: zoo visit
tag.description: A visit to the zoo can provide some `personal moments` in a school setting anime. Or the destination of a field trip. Or it might simply be to visit the animals at the zoo.

tag.name: self-parody
tag.description: The anime is a parody of itself. I.e. the authors make fun of the genre they are portraying, and take the actions of their characters and story lightly.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: randomness
tag.description: The anime does not follow a predictable storyline. New, strange, obscure, or otherwise unexpected story elements are introduced at a whim.

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: みんなのカフェ / カフェのお花見
Everyone`s Cafe / Cafe`s Cherrry Blossom Viewing
Minna no Cafe / Cafe no Ohanami
episode.summary: The patrons of Polar Bear’s Café have their own idea on the dream café, which starts to take form. But when the cherry blossoms start to fall, thoughts turn to having a viewing party, Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しろくまカフェへようこそ / パンダくんの就職
Polar Bear`s Cafe
Shirokuma Cafe e Youkoso / Panda-kun no Shuushoku
episode.summary: Panda, part of generation cupcake, is prodded by his mother to get a job, but he just wants to eat bamboo. While avoiding his mother`s ire he happens upon a cafe run by Polar Bear, who just so happens to be looking for a part-time employee. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スマフォに夢中 / わくわくドライブレッスン
Obsessed with Smartphones / Super Fun Driving Lesson
Smapho ni Muchuu / Wakuwaku Drive Lesson
episode.summary: Penguin is excited about his new smartphone. But the café patrons are not impressed until Panda shows them his new phone. Along with a new smartphone, Penguin is taking driving classes to get his license. Polar Bear has agreed to give him a few pointers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シロクマくん動物園へ / パンダくんの悩み
Polar Bear Goes to the Zoo / Panda`s Problems
Shirokuma-kun Doubutsuen e / Panda-kun no Nayami
episode.summary: Panda has convinced Polar Bear and Penguin to visit him at the zoo. Being their first time, Polar Bear seems to want to go places he is strictly forbidden. Back at the Café, the zoo workers discuss the pains of stereotypes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雑誌取材がやってきた / サケハンター・グリズリーさん
A Magazine Interview Comes By / Salmon Hunter: Mr. Grizzly
Zasshi Shuzai ga Yatte Kita / Sake Hunter: Grizzly-san
episode.summary: The Café is being featured in the magazine, Furafura Walker Monthly. What should be a simple interview proves to be anything but thanks to Furafura unique editor in chief. The Cafe is closed for the day so Polar Bear can get fresh ingredients. A hungry and curious Panda joins Polar Bear and Grizzly Bear on their fishing trip. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 半田さん改造計画 / ラブラブドライブ大作戦
Mr. Handa`s Remodeling Plan / The Great Love Love Driving Operation
Handa-san Kaizou Keikaku / Love Love Drive Daisakusen
episode.summary: Panda new obsession is with popularity, he attempts to raise Mr. Hanada’s popularity with the help of Polar Bear. Penguin finally got his license but now has to get his dating license before he can take Miss Penko out for a drive. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくんのダイエット / 目指せ!ワイルドパンダ
Panda`s Diet / Strive for it! Wild Panda
Panda-kun no Diet / Mezase! Wild Panda
episode.summary: After breaking the slide at work, Panda has decided to lose some weight. His ideal body shape is far from his current look. To fit his new look, Panda wants to be wilder but he admits he was born meek. An invite from Polar Bear leads Panda to the bar, Grizzly’s. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくん張り切る / みんなのパフェ
Panda Gets Enthusiastic / Everyone`s Parfait
Panda-kun Harikiru / Minna no Parfait
episode.summary: Full Time Panda is away for a week, so Panda has to work his shifts. He gets some encouragement from a fan name Rin Rin, who he searches for every day. Mr. Polar Bear wants to serve a special menu and when word gets around it will be Parfaits, everyone has a suggestion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 1
Opening 1
半田さんの合コン? / 半田さんの合コン!
Mr. Handa`s Group Blind Date? / Mr. Handa`s Group Blind Date!
Handa-san no Goukon? / Handa-san no Goukon!
episode.summary: After eating Mr. Handa very plain lunch, Panda gets Mr. Handa invited on a group date in hopes his lunches improves. But when the 3rd male drops out, Panda goes to the café to find a replacement. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リンリン感激!パンダくんち! / ペンギンさんの告白
Rin Rin Deeply Moved! Panda`s House! / Mr. Penguin`s Proposal
Rin Rin Kangeki! Panda-kun Chi! / Penguin-san no Kokuhaku
episode.summary: Rin Rin the florist gets a truly random opportunity to visit the home of Panda, whom he adores. But just meeting Panda Mama and Panda Sister might be too much for him. Meanwhile, Mr. Penguin is getting pumped up to ask Miss Penko out on a date. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 七夕飾り / パンダくんの願い
Tanabata Decorations / Panda`s Wish
Tanabata Kazari / Panda-kun no Negai
episode.summary: The patrons and staff of Polar Bear’s Café prep for Tanabata. This is Panda’s first Tanabata and he is concerned about what to wish for. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペンギンさんの失恋 / パンダくんの夜遊び
Mr. Penguin`s Broken Heart / Panda`s Night Out
Penguin-san no Shitsuren / Panda-kun no Yoasobi
episode.summary: While in the park, Mr. Penguin sees Miss Penko on a date. Grizzly stops by and tells Polar Bear it’s a guy’s night out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくん, ヒマに困る / パンダの悩み相談室
Panda, Tired of Boredom / Panda`s Advice Room for Troubles
Panda-kun, Hima ni Komaru / Panda no Nayami Soudan Shitsu
episode.summary: A rainy day at the zoo leads Panda and his fellow animals to think of creative ways to pass the time. Panda is still worried that Mr. Handa does not have a girlfriend. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グリズリーさん旅立つ / 見知らぬお店
Mr. Grizzly Goes On an Adventure / A Strange Restaurant
Grizzly-san Tabidatsu / Mishiranu Omise
episode.summary: Mr. Grizzly hears some disturbing news about an old friend, and a stranger happens upon Polar Bear’s Café. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真夏の雑草取り / ペンギンさんのロマンス
Weeding in the Summer / Mr. Penguin`s Romance
Manatsu no Zassou Tori / Penguin-san no Romance
episode.summary: The weeds have over grown the Café and Penguin seems to be the only person to care. Afterwards, Penguin finally confesses his love with great results! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シロクマくん張り切る / 海に行こう!
Enthusiastic Polar Bear / Let`s Go to the Beach!
Shirokuma-kun Harikiru / Umi ni Ikou!
episode.summary: Panda and Polar bear decided to switch jobs for the day; it works out well for one of them. Afterwards Panda, Polar Bear, and Penguin decide to spend the day at the beach. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 憧れの一人暮らし / 夏のお祭り
The Ideal Single Living / Summer Festival
Akogare no Hitorigurashi / Natsu no Omatsuri
episode.summary: Panda has decided it is time for him to move out and goes apartment searching with his butler, Mr. Penguin. Polar Bear`s Café and Grizzly`s Bar are teaming up to run a food stall with a special gust, Panda’s “older brother” or something like that. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペンギンにも色々あるよ / バイセンってナンダ!?
There Are Many Kinds of Penguins / What Is Baisen!?
Penguin ni mo Iroiro Aru yo / Baisentte Nanda!?
episode.summary: A trip to the pool pits penguin against penguin, and the secret of Polar Bear’s coffee is revealed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カフェの怪談 / パンダくんの家出
The Cafe`s Ghost Stories / Panda Runs Away from Home
Cafe no Kaidan / Panda-kun no Iede
episode.summary: The staff and regulars of the Café share ghost stores, and Panda doesn’t get the idea of running away. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キャンプに行こう! / 女子高生とリンリン
Let`s Go Camping! / Rin Rin and the High School Girl
Camp ni Ikou! / Joshikousei to Rinrin
episode.summary: Grizzly and Penguin work double duty while camping, and Rin Rin breaks a girl’s heart. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくんの弟子入り / 動物だらけの運動会
Panda`s Apprenticeship / A Sports Day Filled with Animals
Panda-kun no Deshiiri / Doubutsu Darake no Undoukai
episode.summary: Panda is jealous of Masaki apprenticeship with Mr. Tree Kangaroo and is determined to find his own Master. Sasako and Hanada are unexpectedly thrown in the neighborhood sports day. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 半田さんの相談 / パンダママの日常
Mr. Handa`s Discussion / Panda Mama`s Daily Life
Handa-san no Soudan / Panda Mama no Nichijou
episode.summary: Mr. Handa invites Polar Bear out to lunch, while Panda and Penguin discover more about Sasako. Panda Mama has much to learn when it comes to all- you-can-stuff and all-you-can-eat situations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 営業ペンギン / ペンギンさんのピクニック
Sales Penguin / Mr. Penguin Picnic
Eigyou Penguin / Penguin-san no Picnic
episode.summary: The Penguins meet up to discuss ways to move their penguin species cards. Mr. Penguin comes to the café looking for answers to his Penko problem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくんパンダじゃなくなる / メイメイの王子様
Panda Is No Longer a Panda / Mei Mei`s Prince
Panda-kun Panda Janakunaru / Mei Mei no Ouji-sama
episode.summary: With the Zoo Director’s permission, Panda has a change to try his paw in different zoo jobs. Mei Mei finds the lover of her life, in the wrong person. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新しいパンダ / グリズリーバーの同窓会
The New Panda / Reunion at the Grizzly Bar
Atarashii Panda / Grizzly Bar no Dousoukai
episode.summary: Full time panda is scared of losing his job and MC 469MA brings the bar down. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペンギンさんの趣味 / 二人の少年時代
Mr. Penguin`s Hobbies / Their Childhood Days
Penguin-san no Shumi / Futari no Shounen Jidai
episode.summary: Mr. Penguin art exhibit is disturbed by some uncultured guest. Grizzly Bear shares his childhood memories of growing up with Polar Bear. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 動物達のかくし芸大会 / 新年のお客さん
The Animals` Hidden Talent Competition! / New Year`s Guest
Doubutsu-tachi no Kakushigei Taikai / Shinnen no Okiaku-san
episode.summary: The café regulars display there not so hidden talents and while Polar Bear is on a New Year’s vacation, Penguin doesn’t know what to do without being at the café. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カフェの大掃除 / 誰が為に鐘は鳴る?
Big Cleaning at the Cafe / For Whom Does the Bell Toll
Cafe no Daisouji / Dare ga Tame ni Kane wa Naru?
episode.summary: Its end of the year cleaning at the cafe and the New Year brings up reflection. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クリスマス計画 / クリスマス騒動
Christmas Planning! / Christmas Trouble!
Christmas Keikaku / Christmas Soudou
episode.summary: Panda is expecting a wealth of Christmas gifts, but the only one who seems to get him is Rin Rin, and Penguin just wants to party. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グリズリーくんの冬眠準備 / グリズリーくんの冬眠
Grizzly`s Hibernation Preparations! / Grizzly`s Hibernation!
Grizlly-kun no Toumin Junbi / Grizzly-kun no Toumin
episode.summary: Grizzly and Polar Bear go shopping for the perfect pillow, but Polar Bear is not helping much. In the end, Grizzly doesn’t get much sleep. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 働きたいナマケモノくん / 半田さんのプレゼント
Sloth Wants To Work! / Mr. Handa`s Present
Hatarakitai Namakemono-kun / Handa-san no Present
episode.summary: Sloth gets a job, but what for? Lesser Panda and Polar Bear attempt to help Handa pick the perfect gift. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オオカミくんの転職 / ペンギンさんの新しい恋
Wolf`s Occupation Change / Mr. Penguin`s New Love!
Ookami-kun no Tenshoku / Penguin-san no Atarashii Koi
episode.summary: Wolf has quit his job at the bakery and spends some time with his friend Tiger. Mr. Penguin hasn’t been visiting the café recently; it seems he has found a new café… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダコーナーのコンテスト / 焙煎士マサキ / パンダコーナーの企画
Panda Corner Contest! / Coffee Roaster Masaki
Panda Corner no Contest / Abuishi Masaki / Panda Corner no Kikaku
episode.summary: Panda is jealous of the Penguin Action Hero Show and asks his friends how get his popularity back. Masaki taste the bitter truth of why you have to learn all the steps to roasting coffee. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カフェの庭 / 営業ペンギンの営業
The Cafe Yard! / Sales Penguins` Sales!
Cafe no Niwa / Eigyou Penguin no Eigyou
episode.summary: Polar Bear gives his friends a tour of the café’s yard. The Penguins meet up to discuss how to move more penguin cards. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペンギンさんの修羅場 / アイドル・ヤマアラシ
Mr. Penguin`s Dilemma! / Idol: Yama Arashi!
Penguin-san no Shuraba / Idol Yama Arashi
episode.summary: Mr. Penguin has to make a choice of which Penko is right for him. Panda Mama and Ms. King Penguin attend an idol concert! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハロウィーン / ラマデー
Halloween! / Llama Day!
Halloween / Llama Day
episode.summary: Polar Bear, Penguin, and Panda try their hand at trick and treating. Llama sits down with co-workers to discuss himself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくんの新しいバイト / 空飛ぶペンギンさん
Panda`s New Part-Time Job! / Mr. Penguin Goes Flying!
Panda-kun no Atarashii Beit / Soratobu Penguin-san
episode.summary: Panda works his way up the ladder and Penguin dreams of flying. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンダくんのおわび / リンリン, 招かれる
Panda`s Apology! / Rin Rin Welcomed!
Panda-kun no Owabi / Rin Rin, Manakareru
episode.summary: Panda gives Polar Bear the day off and Full-Time Panda invites Rin Rin out for drinks and advice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アニマル草野球・前編 / ジャクーコーヒーってナンダ!? / アニマル草野球・後編
Animal Field Baseball Part 1 / Animal Field Baseball Part 2
Animal Kusa Yakyuu: Zenpen / Jakuu Coffeette Nanda!? / Animal Kusa Yakyuu: Kouhen
episode.summary: Grizzly has sent a declaration of battle to the Café: Wild Animals vs. Polar Bears Source: crunchyroll

ハンモックの海 / パンダママのガーデニング
The Hammock Sea / Panda Mama`s Gardening
Hammock no Umi / Panda Mama no Gardening
episode.summary: Polar Bear tries to enjoy an evening in a Hammock. Panda ruins his mother’s garden and tries to make up for it as best he can. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リンリンとメイメイのドキドキ大作戦 / ワカサギ釣り
Rin Rin and Mei Mei`s Super Exciting Plan / Smelt Fishing
Rin Rin to Mei Mei no Dokidoki Daisakusen / Wagasagizuri
episode.summary: Rin Rin and Mei help each other out in getting dates with their idols. Polar Bear takes everybody smelt fishing with humorous results. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いつもの動物園 / 雨の動物園
The Everyday Zoo! / The Zoo in the Rain
Itsumo no Doubutsuen / Ame no Doubutsuen
episode.summary: A major change at the zoo leaves one attraction a little bit lonelier. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダジャカフェ / コーヒーのおいしさの秘密 / 常勤さんとラマさんとリンリン
Pun Cafe! / Mr. Full-Time Panda, Mr. Llama, and Rin Rin!
Daja Cafe / Coffee no Oishisa no Himitsu / Joukin-san to Llama-san to Rin Rin
episode.summary: Polar Bear gets a taste of what`s it’s like to be on the receiving end of puns. Full-Time Panda and Llama have a wild night! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シロクマくんの不眠症 / グリズリーさんの初恋
Polar Bear`s Insomnia / Mr. Grizzly`s First Love
Shirokuma-kun no Fuminshou / Grizzly-san no Hatsukoi
episode.summary: The café patrons suggest different ways to cure Polar Bear’s insomnia. Unable to sleep, Grizzly does some work around the café while Polar Bear shares a story from their youth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなで豆まき / 午後のカフェ
Scattering Beans With Everyone / The Cafe in the Afternoon
Minna de Mame Maki / Gogo no Cafe
episode.summary: The animals gather at the café for the traditional scattering of the beans. Sasako and Llama share a quiet afternoon together reminiscing about their youth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グリズリーさんの再会 / ラマさんのタイムカプセル
Mr. Grizzly`s Reunion / Mr. Llama`s Time Capsule
Grizzly-san no Saikai / Llama-san no Time Capsule
episode.summary: Grizzly gets a surprise visit and the Café patrons go on a treasure hunt. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナマケモノくんの旅行 / 人形になった / ホワイトデー
Sloth`s Trip / I Became a Doll / White Day
Namakemono-kun no Ryokou / Ningyou ni Natta / White Day
episode.summary: Sloth sets out for a hot spring, the café crew takes a trip around the world, and Mr. Hana is confused on what to get Sasako. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 南極戦隊ペンギンジャー / まだまだ焙煎ってナンダ!?
South Pole Squad Penguinger / Even More, What is Roasting!?
Nankyoku Sentai Penguinjaa / Madamada Abuitte Nanda!?
episode.summary: The Penguins get their chance to shine on the Yama Yama! Yama Arashi! Show! Masaki wants his chance to roast coffee, but doesn’t get encouragement from everyone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひなまつり / 動物のお医者さん
Doll Festival / The Animal Doctor
Hinamatsuri / Doubutsu no Oisha-san
episode.summary: The baby penguins set up for the traditional doll festival. Polar Bear gets sick and it’s up to his friends to take care of him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペンギンさんの秘密 / 春のお花見
Mr. Penguin`s Secret / Cherry Blossom Viewing in Spring
Penguin-san no Himitsu / Haru no Ohanami
episode.summary: Panda and Polar Bear team up to figure out some of Penguin’s secrets. Everyone get together for a cherry blossom viewing. Source: crunchyroll
